Comment: I'm from Boston so when i saw that my opponent was a "New York Lovers" member, i decided to put extra time into the games! Also it is my first ever completed game as a member of "The Sneaky Knight Connection"... Thanks to my awesome captain gothicgirl for setting up the game.

this attacks his bishop and also removes one of the two pieces separating my white bishop from attacking G2 and pinning the white knight in its place by threatening mate
trying to prevent the d5 push and win some space for this bishop.... also sets up a 2-1 white pawn majority on the queenside.... i thought this might prove problematic later in the game

eliminating the only defender of the one piece between my bishop and G2.... he will capture with the queen to avoid losing the pawn.... his position of having the queen in front of the rook later is very problematic for him
